Anthropology

An in-depth study of human societies, cultures, and behaviors, exploring topics such as social structures, rituals, kinship, and more.

3500/=

Archaeology

Uncover the mysteries of the past through the examination of artifacts, excavation techniques, and the interpretation of ancient civilizations.

Cultural Studies

Explore the rich diversity of cultures worldwide, examining their traditions, customs, beliefs, and the impact of globalization.

Linguistics

Study language as a cultural phenomenon, investigating its structure, evolution, variation, and the role it plays in communication and identity.

Human Evolution

Trace the origins and development of human beings, exploring the biological, genetic, and behavioral aspects of our evolutionary history.

Visual Anthropology

Learn how to use visual media, including photography and film, as tools for documenting and understanding diverse cultures and societies.
